reviewText: Very good!!!
This is the best biography I have seen of Sam Giancana. With lots of home movies and never before seen pictures. Loved it.

Plenty of pictures and speculation as to did Sam Giancana had something to do with the Kennedy assassination, which like most theories on that subject, it has never been proved. The documentary is acceptable, most of the pictures show in black and white, but it is not all that great. 3 Stars.

I had just finished watching the mini series "The Kennedys" Sam Giancana was portrayed as someone who wasn't someone you wanted to deal with but this documentary made the man sound like a joke...its so disjointed in its story telling it seems to me no one no one really knew him. Ironically I guess ill have to find a book that does Giancana justice...but this documentary was a waste of time

Labored, arcane, moves at a glacial pace, and riddled by quaint reminiscences of a whole host of Giancana family members/ associates, make watching this document an exercise in self-discipline. Go to Youtube and watch one of several 45-minute documentaries that will distill Sam Giancana's life down to its essentials, instead of slogging through this documentary.

What is the truth about Chicago's #2???  This doc. attempts, and seriously so, to run down every alley and corridor that marks this guys's life.  Whether accurate or conjecture it is a fascinating glimpse into a life only heretofore covered in newsprint and Media of that era beginning in the 20's until his death.  A career that connects him to some of the biggest names in show biz and politics.  So many facets of this story are moot, that I sincerely doubt anyone will know exactly who killed him.  Amazing sidelights and interviews with people and players who filled and dotted his life!
The story of Sam Giancana, told not only using archival material, but from his daughters' point of view.  Not surprisingly, the daughters knew a very different man from the mafia boss.
Great historical insight.
This is an excellent documentary on this very complicated man.  A mobster who managed to love his family and at the same time rise to the top of "The Outfit" in Chicago.
Very interesting story
great show
PRETTY INTERESTING
I'm from Chicago.  Always love a good Mafia story

An interesting look at a notorious mobster. Some of it was a little "conspiracy theory" disguised as facts. At the end I read the credits and saw that this daughters and grand nephew wrote and produced it. Even though I question a lot of it it was interesting hearing from those close to him.
I thought the Nick Celozzi part was unnessessaryy and disingenuous
Is just an interesting to see how theses  gangsters get away with crime back in the days
He was a great husband and father but also a ruthless murderer. Everyone has a good side....even monsters.
Excellent!
It was informative.
this was so well done. my heart went out to the daughters too.

Fast paced and insightful, this shows both the human and inhumane sides of the gang leader. The double life included murder/brutality and short tempered nature that drew too much attention to the mob world and led to his demise, and his daughters who felt raptured by his presence and kindness he infused in their lives. Was the mob responsible for JFK's assassination? This movie leaves no doubt that its makers believe it was. Were the sex lives of the almighty Kennedys and others given mostly a nod and a wink by the media? You bet. This is a well-done tale no matter where your politics reside.
Excellent!  History that makes sense.

The info provided in this documentary  answered many questions about, among other things, the Kennedy assassination.  It concurs with other info, not in this doc, about many political and non political events that occurred during this time period.  Very interesting.  My only complaint is that the quality of the video was not great, very grainy.

I found it amusing that when the narrator was talking about a west side restaurant called "Mary's", the accompanying image was of a restaurant called "Hamburger Mary's"  located in Andersonville.  Makes one wonder how competent the research was in other areas.
Good documentary.
His karma finally caught up with him. He lived by the sword and died the same way.
learned a lot hope its all true
Just ok
If you like mob stories, then this is a good one. Very interesting.
Not worth watching

Did not like this movie. I really tried to watch it all the way through and couldn't. What I did watch was a waste of time. I found it mostly boring, slow moving, and seemed like it was heading no where. Finally gave up.
Informative.
Very interesting. Gave a more three dimensional look at the man.
Pretty good account of this notorious crime boss.
Another informative documentary. Live by the gun, die by the gun.

At some point I felt like I wanted to execute the cross-eyed idiot daughter.  It's much longer than is warranted, and the best stuff is quickly passed over - Jack Ruby.  The guy is a killer.  He loved his children.  So did all the others he murdered.
Loved it....

I just watched this last night as it was included in Amazon Prime. I have been fascinated about the different accounts of the JFK assassination since my childhood, and the suggested connections between Giancana, Joe Kennedy, JFK, Bobby Kennedy, Jack Ruby, Oswald (if true) in this film are plausible. It moves rather slow for the first hour with interviews with Giancana's daughters, but the last hour ties up some loose ends in the tangled web of the mafia-JFK conspiracy theory.
The story was a true account of a Chicago mobster who ran the Chicago mob!
Very informative. Learned some things I didn't know
Liked this movie, I like movies based on true stories, and real people's lives. If you likes these type movies, Inthink this one is for you.
Very informative, although sometimes somewhat overwrought.
I would recommend renting it. Definitely not a 5 star movie.
Good insight into a bizarre man.
Excellent
Too bad somebody didn't shoot him 30 years sooner.
Interesting information
Informative but it seemed to move very slowly.
Get past the intro and biased accounts from his daughters (totally understandable), has some interesting historical info.
I have always enjoyed mob related documentaries.

Very interesting and eye opening documentary about the life & times of Sam Giancana.  The producer did a good job of linking Giancana to the failed assignation of Fidel Castro.  Lot's of interesting factoids & vintage footage of the times.
Super Duper awsome...!!!! will sure open up your EYE'S on a LOT of things
Excellent biography.

Terrible. There's no real source material here except boring reminiscences of the Giancana family about how nice their father was. Their father was a stone cold killer, a murderer responsible for hateful acts, many deaths, corruption and destroying people lives and corrupting the American dream. This 'doc' whitewashes all of that (if it didn't it might have been more interesting), and doesn't really get into detail about the man. Additionally, it has many facts wrong. For example, it states that JFK reneged on his promise for air cover in the Bay of Pigs. That is incorrect and easy to find that the truth is more complicated that a simple finger pointing. Do I need to say that the interviews all look like they were filmed by an amateur? The lighting is lousy and the 'experts' are unconvincing and have no depth. A waste of time.
Interesting piece of history.
I love Bio movies and this one was great.
Very informative
Fascinating story and very well done!
It was OK. I liked the differences between the two daughters. Interesting to think that the Msguire sister got the money
Interesting
Seemed to cover most of Giancans's life so I gave it 4 stars. But they could have told more of his life in regards to his relations with the Kennedys/
Nothing more than OK
Interesting how he can be linked to Marilyn Monroe, Frank Sinatra and JFK.
interesting
It was a great documentary
Very interesting possible biography of this man. If everything is true he had a major impact on the history of this country.
Horrible

Excellent "birds eye view" into the man, the father and the mobster.
The connection with Jack Ruby throughout confirms the mob's involvement with the Kennedy assassination.
Interesting, but nothing really new about the subject.
If you have an interest in organized crime, this is pretty interesting and well worth seeing.

Absolutely fascinating.  The complexities of this man were astounding.  Having grown up in the 60s I surely had heard of him, knew that he was a gangster, knew about Chicago,Vegas and Cuba.  But Jacob Rubenstein, Bobbie and President Kennedy and the very close connections!  Wow.  This was riveting.
Good documentary
Poor photography diminished the chance for extra stars. Some of the most important episodes got too short coverage.
It's a great documentary! Loved it
SO Boring! Do I really care that he had 2 christmas trees each year? Terrible film making...more like propaganda about what a swell guy he was. Waste of time.
Interesting
This is worth watching, I enjoyeded it.  If you are not familiar with Sam, you should take the time to watch this.  His fingers were in a lot of things.
well done documentary with plenty of facts and raises interesting questions . Highly recommend it for those who have an interest in the Chicago mob/outfit.
Interesting. Lots of info.
It was just ok
It must have been difficult to edit the story of Sam Giancana into a short video presentation.  I did, however, find the storyline as well as the home movies, interesting.

There is so much revealed in this show about the unbelievable connections between major players of the mob and our government and CIA and FBI, Jack Ruby and Oswald that it's hard to comprehend. A must watch for everyone.  I've went back and watched it several times. You may never look at our government the same.

For all of us who knew the Kennedy clan from Massachusetts, this was a reaffirmation of the fallout of their arrogant aggressiveness in politics. They pushed too hard and the results were so tragic for themselves and our nation. Far from being Camelot, this was a fair assessment allowing the viewer to conclude for themselves what happened on the grassy knoll. One of the best documentaries I have viewed. Bravo!
Not very good.
Very interesting movie. I

Informative and entertaining. The whole Kennedy thing, well, OK add it to the list. There are as many theories about the Kennedy assassination as there are stars in the sky. Considering all the theories around the Kennedy assassination, it's amazing he wasn't shot a hundred times. The mob, the CIA, the Russians, the Republicans, the FBI,  the Federal Reserve, Castro! Jeez! This guy pissed off everybody. Did anyone like him?
This documentary is well done and has a lot of information about the mans life, his family and his role in history.
Good movie
Very informative!
interesting history

I enjoyed this documentary.  Since there are still a lot of questions regarding Kennedy's assignation, it was interesting to see one more opinion or insight.  I had never heard of Sam Giancaca before now, so I liked it. Daughters indicate Sam was really a nice guy?  Being their father I guess one  would be biased.  In reality he killed and from this doc appeared to be a real SOB. How can one be a nice guy while being a ruthless hit man?
pretty informative and finally got the jack Ruby connection with the Mob
informative story of Giancana's life, his rise and fall.
You want the real story and some interesting facts??? GET this movie and watch it.
Very good documentary. If you enjoy Mob and Mafia content, this is a must watch!
Interesting but not much that hasn't been heard over and over.
Good program. not very good picture quality.
Erases the lone gun theory all together! Direct connections between the mob, CIA and the president! Best documentary on JFK's assassination.
only missing Antoinette the oldest Daughter

I have read many books on the Kennedy's. After seeing this and listening to key people give their first hand accounts I can see a real possibility to this mafia connection to the Kennedy assassination in Dallas. The Marilyn connection was another real component.  Sam was a very strong and complex character. Now I need to go watch The Godfather.
a must watch and learn
Momo was produced nicely and the info was new to me.  I enjoyed it very much.

Alot of hype and exaggeration...simply put, the connections between bad guys and good guys is quite a stretch ...I can't buy into the idea that a mafia family including cousins, uncles, movie stars, hit men, and corrupt politicians could all be "connected", ...
very bad documentary
It was very good tells a lot about this man who was a real creep. he is dead good
If your interested in crime boss stories, this one is great. Simple in the way it's put together but a great timeline of his life from beginning to end. Excellent story window of Chicago crime.
A documentary that lists facts and explains the story behind the theories of recent history: the deaths of JFK and Marilyn Monore.
Interesting story of the life of Sam Giancana and the mob.
This was a very good documentary from the inside, family, on Sam Giancana. A lot of video, pictures and personal insights.
I liked it

Very interesting and informative.  No white-washing.  This man helped make the world significantly more evil, especially by partnering with the CIA to kill JFK.  I didn't realize he also killed Marilyn Monroe but it doesn't surprise me at all.
One of the most interesting docs I've watched. Fascinating information, very plausible and thought provoking.
Probably made to whitewash the CIA's role in JFK's murder. At this point anyone who seriously doubts the CIA + military involvement is seriously mentally ill.
This was so good, I had to give it five stars, but I just wonder how accurate these discoveries are.
Very eye opening !
Incredibly boring.
good movies, added to my collection
